boundedBuffer

Class AbstractBuffer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • boundedBuffer.AbstractBuffer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of object stored in the buffer.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Buffer

    public abstract class AbstractBuffer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of buffers using semaphores to protect access to the buffer.
    Version:
    January 2020
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private T[] buffer
      The buffer.
      private int elements
      The number of elements currently in the buffer.
      private int getIndex
      Index to the current position in the array where the next item should be removed.
      private boolean isOpen
      Is the buffer currently open?
      private int putIndex
      Index to the current position in the array where the next item should be added.

    • Constructor Summary

      The constructor sets the size of the buffer, and initialises the buffer pointers.

    • Field Detail

      • buffer

        private T[] buffer
        The buffer.

      • putIndex

        private int putIndex
        Index to the current position in the array where the next item should be added. I.e. the index of the "first" empty space in the buffer.

      • getIndex

        private int getIndex
        Index to the current position in the array where the next item should be removed. I.e. the index of the "first" non-empty space in the buffer.

      • elements

        private int elements
        The number of elements currently in the buffer.

      • isOpen

        private boolean isOpen
        Is the buffer currently open?

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractBuffer

        public AbstractBuffer(int size)
        The constructor sets the size of the buffer, and initialises the buffer pointers.
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the buffer

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open()
        Open the buffer.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws SemaphoreError
        Close the buffer.
        Throws:
        SemaphoreError - if any of the semaphores exceed their limits. This exception would probably arise as a consequence of an error in the implementation of semaphores.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Check if the buffer is open.
        Returns:
        (the buffer is open)

      • put

        public abstract boolean put(T item)
                     throws BufferError,
                            SemaphoreError
        Provide protected access to the buffer to allow an item to be added.
        Parameters:
        item - the data item to be added to the buffer
        Returns:
        true iff the put succeeded. A put might fail if the buffer has closed between the put request, and the actual put.
        Throws:
        BufferError - if it is not possible to add an item to the buffer due to an interrupted exception.
        SemaphoreError - if any of the semaphores exceeds their limit. This exception would probably arise as a consequence of an error in the implementation of semaphores.

      • get

        public abstract T get()
               throws BufferError,
                      SemaphoreError
        Provide protected access to the buffer to allow an item to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the data item that has been in the buffer longest or null if the retrieval failed because, e.g.., the buffer has closed.
        Throws:
        BufferError - if it was not possible to retrieve an item from the buffer due to an interrupted exception.
        SemaphoreError - if any of the semaphores exceeds their limit. This exception would probably arise as a consequence of an error in the implementation of semaphores.

      • putItem

        boolean putItem(T item)
         throws BufferError
        Add a data item to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        item - the data item to be added to the buffer
        Returns:
        true iff the item was successfully added. A putItem() might fail if the buffer has closed between the put request, and the actual put.
        Throws:
        BufferError - if the buffer is already full

      • getItem

        T getItem()
   throws BufferError
        Retrieve a data item from the buffer.
        Returns:
        datum the data item that has been in the buffer longest, or null if the buffer has closed.
        Throws:
        BufferError - if the buffer is empty.
